name: wise

B2 approving having or showing the ability to make good judgments, based on a deep understanding and experience of life: I think you made a wise choice. "I never drink more than three glasses of wine." "How wise." Looking at the weather, I think we made a wise decision not to go to the coast this weekend.wise to I think it would be wiser to wait and see how much money you have left before you make any decisions.older and wiser I never used to save money but now I'm a little older and wiser I can see the point of it. Was it Thomas More who said that the wise man learns from the experience of others?
